Package org.eclipse.imagen.media.imagefunction

Class ImageFunctionExtWrapper

Object
ImageFunctionExtWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageFunction, ImageFunctionExt
public class ImageFunctionExtWrapper extends Object implements ImageFunctionExt
Wrapper function used for wrapping ImageFunction objects in order to implement ImageFunctionExt interface.
Author:
Nicola Lagomarsini GeoSolutions

  • Method Details

    • getElements

      public void getElements(float arg0, float arg1, float arg2, float arg3, int arg4, int arg5, int arg6, float[] arg7, float[] arg8)
      Description copied from interface: ImageFunction
      Returns all values of a given element for a specified set of coordinates. An ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException may be thrown if the length of the supplied array(s) is insufficient.
      Specified by:
      getElements in interface ImageFunction
      Parameters:
      arg0 - The X coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      arg1 - The Y coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      arg2 - The horizontal increment.
      arg3 - The vertical increment.
      arg4 - The number of points in the horizontal direction.
      arg5 - The number of points in the vertical direction.
      arg7 - A pre-allocated float array of length at least countX*countY in which the real parts of all elements will be returned.
      arg8 - A pre-allocated float array of length at least countX*countY in which the imaginary parts of all elements will be returned; may be null for real data, i.e., when isComplex() returns false.

    • getElements

      public void getElements(double arg0, double arg1, double arg2, double arg3, int arg4, int arg5, int arg6, double[] arg7, double[] arg8)
      Description copied from interface: ImageFunction

      Parameters:
      arg0 - The X coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      arg1 - The Y coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      arg2 - The horizontal increment.
      arg3 - The vertical increment.
      arg4 - The number of points in the horizontal direction.
      arg5 - The number of points in the vertical direction.
      arg7 - A pre-allocated double array of length at least countX*countY in which the real parts of all elements will be returned.

    • getElements

      public void getElements(float startX, float startY, float deltaX, float deltaY, int countX, int countY, int element, float[] real, float[] imag, Rectangle destRect, ROI roi, Range nodata, float destNoData)
      Description copied from interface: ImageFunctionExt
      Returns all values of a given element for a specified set of coordinates. An ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException may be thrown if the length of the supplied array(s) is insufficient.
      Specified by:
      getElements in interface ImageFunctionExt
      Parameters:
      startX - The X coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      startY - The Y coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      deltaX - The horizontal increment.
      deltaY - The vertical increment.
      countX - The number of points in the horizontal direction.
      countY - The number of points in the vertical direction.
      real - A pre-allocated float array of length at least countX*countY in which the real parts of all elements will be returned.
      imag - A pre-allocated float array of length at least countX*countY in which the imaginary parts of all elements will be returned; may be null for real data, i.e., when isComplex() returns false.
      destRect - Destination Rectangle where the results must be calculated
      roi - Optional ROI used for reducing calculations to a defined region
      nodata - Optional NoData range to use for masking particular values
      destNoData - Value to set for pixels which are not accepted or are outside ROI

    • getElements

      public void getElements(double startX, double startY, double deltaX, double deltaY, int countX, int countY, int element, double[] real, double[] imag, Rectangle destRect, ROI roi, Range nodata, float destNoData)
      Description copied from interface: ImageFunctionExt
      Returns all values of a given element for a specified set of coordinates. An ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException may be thrown if the length of the supplied array(s) is insufficient.
      Specified by:
      getElements in interface ImageFunctionExt
      Parameters:
      startX - The X coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      startY - The Y coordinate of the upper left location to evaluate.
      deltaX - The horizontal increment.
      deltaY - The vertical increment.
      countX - The number of points in the horizontal direction.
      countY - The number of points in the vertical direction.
      real - A pre-allocated double array of length at least countX*countY in which the real parts of all elements will be returned.
      imag - A pre-allocated double array of length at least countX*countY in which the imaginary parts of all elements will be returned; may be null for real data, i.e., when isComplex() returns false.
      destRect - Destination Rectangle where the results must be calculated
      roi - Optional ROI used for reducing calculations to a defined region
      nodata - Optional NoData range to use for masking particular values
      destNoData - Value to set for pixels which are not accepted or are outside ROI
